tit.e: Ikaruganomiya Palace (an ancient Imperial Palace where Prince Shotoku lived in present-day Ikaruga Town)
Ikaruganomiya Palace (an ancient Imperial Palace where Prince Shotoku lived in present-day Ikaruga Town)

sen.j: 斑鳩宮（いかるがのみや）は、聖徳太子が現在の奈良県生駒郡斑鳩町に営んだ宮。
sen.e: Ikaruganomiya Palace is a palace which was operated by Prince Shotoku in today's Ikaruga-cho, Ikoma-gun, Nara Prefecture.
Ikaruganomiya Palace was the palace where Prince Shotoku lived in present-day Ikaruga Town, Ikoma County, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: Ikaruganomiya Palace was the palace where Prince Shotoku lived in present-day Ikaruga Town, Ikoma County, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 聖徳太子は、推古天皇9年（601年）に斑鳩宮を造営し、推古天皇13年（605年）に移り住んだ。
sen.e: Prince Shotoku built Ikaruganomiya Palace in 601, and moved to the palace in 605.

sen.j: また、太子の手により法隆寺は斑鳩宮の西方に建立された。
sen.e: In addition, Horyu-ji Temple was erected by the prince in the west area of Ikaruganomiya Palace.

sen.j: 太子の薨去後、太子の王子山背大兄王が住んだが、皇極天皇2年（643年）に蘇我入鹿の兵によって宮は焼き払われ、山背大兄王以下、上宮王家の人々は法隆寺で自殺に追い込まれた。
sen.e: After the death of Prince Shotoku, his prince, Prince Yamashiro no oe lived in the palace, however, the palace was burnt away by SOGA no Iruka's soldiers in 643, and Prince Yamashiro no oe and other people in Jogu Oke were forced to kill themselves in Horyu-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 「太子の薨去後」は「（聖徳）太子の薨去後」を補って"After the death of Prince Shotoku"と訳出しています。
sen.e: After the death of Prince Shotoku, his prince, Prince Yamashiro no oe lived in the palace, however, the palace was burnt away by SOGA no Iruka's soldiers in 643, and Prince Yamashiro no oe and other people in Jogu Oke (Prince Shotoku's family) were forced to kill themselves in Horyu-ji Temple.
